pages.text: A rare sight, these trees seem to be an uncommon yet packed sight in this dimension. Their stem seems to be made out of a hard chitinous substance with a fleshy interior that houses some water and nutrients.

pages.title: Growth Cycle
pages.text: These trees seem to grow fairly quickly, possibly sharing a common evolutionary lineage with overworld bamboo. As they grow, chorus trees branch outwards, carrying their flower higher and higher, eventually splitting it off into duplicates through a bewildering mitotic process. Most trees seem to bear 1-8 flowers, with the numbers being highly variable and dependent on available space.

pages.title: Fruit
pages.text: A chorus tree's interior xylem seems to be mostly edible though may pose adverse side effects due to the abundance of $(l)Warpus Rickettsia$(). Consuming chorus fruit therefore poses a minor yet life-threatening risk of contracting Typhus Fever alongside the typical warping effects of the bacterium. Survivors should only eat this food source as a last resort against starvation.
